page.title: 16GOWY VALLEY ECOLOGY
page.content: The{WEATHER}is mainly damp because of prevailing south westerly winds, mild because of the influence of the Gulf stream and protection of the Pennines. {HEALTH}reflects age and affluence of populace and is generally good. {POLLUTION}No direct pollution occurs in this given area, however water supplies from the River Dee at Chester have been polluted, occasionally to dangerous levels by industry upstream. Also Petrochemical industry at Ellesmere Port emits waste which effects the area when prevailing wind drops. {TRADE}All villages have a Post Office and are served by general provision shops. Several businesses have their origins in agriculture, a freezer centre, horse drawn carriages & an agricultural supplier.
